comment.author: 11572312@N00
comment._content: was it one of these crashes? (although Westbrook is on the photo, can't see any train wreck news out of Westbrook, so far, just these items). ------------------------------------------------------------- 12 DIE IN WRECK, 47 INJURED, ON BOSTON FLIER; The New Haven's Federal Express Crashes Down an Embankment at Bridgeport. Special to The New York Times. July 12, 1911, Wednesday Page 1, 3579 words BRIDGEFORT, Conn., July 11. -- The Federal Express, on the New York, New Haven Hartford Railroad, the train to which President Taft's private car is invariably attached when he goes to New England, running from Washington to Boston, plunged down an eighteen-foot embankment one mile and a half west of the Bridgeport station at 3:35 o'clock this morning, killing twelve persons outright and injuring forty-seven others, several of whom are expected to die. query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9F06E4D61431E233A... ---------------------------------- HOLD TRAINMEN FOR NEW HAVEN WRECK; Coroner Lodges Manslaughter Charge Against Engineer, Conductor, and Flagman. September 16, 1913, Tuesday Page 5, 1087 words NEW HAVEN, Sept. 15. -- August B. Miller engineer of the White Mountain Express, which crashed into the Bar Harbor Express at North Haven, on the New Haven Road, on Sept. 2, and Bruce G. Adams, conductor, and Charles J. Murray, flagman, of the Bar Harbor Express, are held responsible for the fatal wreck by Coroner Mix, who handed down his finding to-day. query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9D03E2D8123FE633A...

comment.author: 11166518@N00
comment._content: By description it would be the July 11 Bridgeport byline.  North Haven is on a different line from Westport (which is geographically closer to Bridgeport on the same NYNH&H line).

comment.author: 77975599@N03
comment._content: This accident appears to be on a steel supported wood bridge rather than down an embankment.
